Uses of Interface
harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.ILogger

  • Uses of ILogger in harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

    Classes in harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib that implement ILogger 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  TSimpleLogger
    TSimpleLogger is a quite simple class helping to manage the important task of take trace (that is, log) of actions made by all maior TombolaLib methods. I know I could have chosen to use many beautiful, complex, logger solutions and packages already available for Java, but I preferred to reduce to the minimum external dependencies and keep things as simple as possible. Main principles to use this class and its objects follows: Each library user can prepare his own logger objects using one of the overloaded static TSimpleLogger.prepareLogger(java.lang.String, harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.ILogger.TLogLevel, java.io.PrintStream) method available.
    Fields in harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib declared as ILogger 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected ILogger TAbstractSetFactory.logger  
    Methods in harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib that return ILogger 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    ILogger ISetFactory.getLogger()
    Return the current ILogger object used by the factory to communicate progresses and errors during the card generation process.
    ILogger TAbstractSetFactory.getLogger()
    Return the logger used by this set factory object.
    ILogger TGame.getLogger()
    Return the ILogger interface implementing object associated to this game.
    Methods in harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib with parameters of type ILogger 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void ISetFactory.setLogger​(ILogger logger)
    Set the logger object that the factory will use to trace its activities and "communicate" to the externals. It MUST be set during the INITALIZATION phase and cannot be changed during the following phases of the generation process.
    void TAbstractSetFactory.setLogger​(ILogger logger)
    Set the TSimpleLogger object used by the generation heuristic to trace relevant events and errors. It can be set only during the INITIALIZING or READY phase, not in following statuses.
    void TGame.setLogger​(ILogger logger)
    Set the logger object that will be used during the game to spool all relevant messages regarding the status of the match.
